[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnHeaderIPC] [Consensus Divergence] Can the height() method return inconsistent values across multiple calls for the same header, allowing different nodes to process the same header at different heights and causing chain fork? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnHeaderIPC] [Data Integrity] Does the header_hash() method guarantee deterministic output for the same header data, or could non-deterministic hashing lead to consensus divergence when different nodes compute different hashes? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnHeaderIPC] [Integer Overflow] Can height() return u64::MAX causing integer overflow in arithmetic operations when implementations use it for range calculations or array indexing? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnHeaderIPC] [Type Safety] Does the [u8; 32] return type for header_hash() enforce Bitcoin's 32-byte hash format, or could implementations return incorrect hash lengths for other blockchains causing buffer overflows? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnHeaderIPC] [Race Condition] With Send + Sync bounds, can concurrent calls to height(), header(), and header_hash() return inconsistent snapshots of header state during updates, violating atomicity? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnHeaderIPC] [Missing Validation] Is there any constraint ensuring header() and header_hash() are cryptographically linked, or could malicious implementations return valid headers with incorrect hashes? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnBlockIPC] [Consensus Divergence] Can height() return a different value than header().height(), causing nodes to process the same block at different heights and fork the chain? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnBlockIPC] [Data Integrity] Is there enforcement that block() contains transactions corresponding to the header returned by header(), or could implementations return mismatched block/header pairs? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnBlockIPC] [Type Safety] Does the Self::H: BurnHeaderIPC constraint guarantee that header() returns a valid BurnHeaderIPC, or could unsafe implementations bypass this with invalid headers? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnBlockIPC] [Race Condition] Can concurrent threads call height(), header(), and block() and receive non-atomic snapshots where block data doesn't match header data due to intermediate updates? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockDownloader] [DoS Attack] Can the download() method be called with maliciously crafted headers causing unbounded memory allocation or infinite loops without timeout mechanisms? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockDownloader] [Data Integrity] Does download() validate that the returned block's header matches the input header parameter, or could it return blocks with different headers causing consensus issues? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockDownloader] [Error Handling] Can download() return Ok() with partial/corrupted block data instead of proper error, causing downstream parsing to process invalid blocks? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockDownloader] [Network Attack] Is there protection against download() accepting blocks from untrusted sources that could contain malicious data, or does validation happen only in parsing? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockDownloader] [Resource Exhaustion] Can repeated download() calls with invalid headers exhaust network resources or file descriptors without rate limiting at the trait level? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockParser] [Consensus Divergence] Can parse() produce different BurnchainBlock results for the same input block depending on epoch_id, and could epoch_id manipulation cause chain forks? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockParser] [Validation Bypass] Does parse() enforce that the epoch_id parameter matches the block's actual epoch, or could passing wrong epoch_id bypass validation rules? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockParser] [Integer Overflow] Can parse() handle blocks at epoch boundaries where epoch_id transitions could cause integer overflow in height calculations? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockParser] [Error Handling] Can parse() return Ok() with a partially validated BurnchainBlock when encountering invalid transactions, allowing invalid blocks into consensus? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockParser] [Determinism] Is parse() guaranteed to be deterministic for the same block and epoch_id across all nodes, or could implementation differences cause consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainBlockParser] [DoS Attack] Can parse() be exploited with specially crafted blocks that take exponential time to parse, causing DoS without gas/cost limits at trait level? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/burnchains/indexer.rs] [Trait: BurnchainIndexer::connect()] [State Corruption] If connect() fails partway through initialization, is state properly cleaned up, or could partial initialization corrupt the indexer state? (High)
